alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 12 at 5:22PM PDT until March 15 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: .2 to 3 inches of rain is expected to fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to increasing snowmelt. Flows in small creeks, streams and rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. Major rivers are not anticipated to flood at this time. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM PDT MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Areal flooding in small creeks and streams caused by rain and snowmelt is possible. Flash flooding within the McKinney burn scar is also possible. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following areas, Central Siskiyou County, South Central Siskiyou County and Western Siskiyou County. * WHEN...From 5 AM PDT Monday through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Small creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Large quantities of moisture are anticipated to move into the region between Sunday night through Tuesday. With snow levels increasing above 5000 feet, there is an increased risk of areal flooding in small creeks, streams and flood prone areas. Some data sets show the 24 hour rain rates could be in excess of 3 inches, which is fairly high for 24 hours in Mt. Shasta City. The Weather Prediction Center has also issued a Moderate Risk for excessive rainfall for the watch area Monday into Tuesday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County
